meta.title: Session 34: PowerPoint Review Tab & Business Pitch
meta.description: Mastering the Review Tab features (Proofing, Comments, Compare), designing a persuasive Business Pitch for a Cafe, and exploring AI video tools.

studyTopics.hint: Tools for checking spelling, language, and accessibility.
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Utilize proofing, language, and accessibility tools to finalize a presentation.

studyTopics.hint: Slides that sell your idea (Problem, Solution, Market).
studyTopics.searchQuery: key elements of a successful business pitch deck
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Structure a professional business presentation to attract investors or partners.

studyTopics.searchQuery: how to use comments and compare in powerpoint
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Collaborate effectively by adding comments and comparing presentation versions.

studyTopics.hint: AI for video editing and creation.
studyTopics.searchQuery: Runway Gen-2 vs Hedra AI features
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Understand how AI tools can assist in generating and editing creative video content.

studyTopics.hint: Making sure everyone can read your slides.
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Identify and fix issues that make presentations difficult for people with disabilities.

questions.question: Which tab in PowerPoint contains the 'Spelling' and 'Thesaurus' tools?
questions.explanation: The Review tab is the hub for proofing tools like Spelling, Thesaurus, and Translate.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a 'Business Pitch'?
options: To persuade investors or partners to support a business idea
questions.explanation: A business pitch is a presentation designed to secure funding, partnerships, or customers for a business venture.

questions.question: Runway is an AI platform primarily known for:
options: Creative tools for video editing and generation
questions.explanation: Runway offers a suite of AI tools specifically for creative professionals, focusing on video generation and editing.

questions.question: Which feature in the Review tab checks your presentation for issues that might make it difficult for people with disabilities to read?
questions.explanation: The 'Check Accessibility' tool scans for missing alt text, low contrast, and other issues affecting accessibility.

questions.question: In a Business Pitch for a Cafe, which slide would typically describe who your customers are?
questions.explanation: The Target Market slide identifies the demographics and psychographics of the people likely to visit the cafe.

questions.question: What does the 'Compare' feature in the Review tab allow you to do?
options: View and merge differences between two versions of the same presentation
questions.explanation: Compare allows you to open a second version of the file and see the changes combined into the current one for review.

questions.question: Which tool would you use to find a synonym (different word with same meaning) for 'Delicious' in your presentation?
questions.explanation: The Thesaurus feature suggests synonyms and antonyms for selected words.

questions.question: Hedra is mentioned as an AI tool for:
options: Video Creation with Advanced AI Models
questions.explanation: Hedra is an AI platform focused on revolutionizing video creation.

questions.question: To add a note or feedback to a specific part of a slide for a colleague to read, you should use:
questions.explanation: Comments are used for collaboration, allowing reviewers to leave feedback without altering the slide content.

questions.question: If you want to translate a selected text on your slide into French, which group in the Review tab should you use?
questions.explanation: The Language group contains the 'Translate' and 'Language' preferences options.

questions.question: What is the 'Problem Slide' in a pitch deck meant to do?
options: Show that the presenter is angry
Identify a specific gap or pain point in the market that the business will solve
List the problems with the computer
questions.explanation: The Problem slide sets the stage by highlighting the issue the business intends to resolve.

questions.question: Which shortcut key typically opens the Spelling check in Office applications?
questions.explanation: F7 is the standard keyboard shortcut to run the Spelling checker.

questions.question: When 'Showing Comments', where do they usually appear?
options: In the middle of the screen blocking everything
In a pane on the right side of the window
In a separate popup window only
questions.explanation: The Comments Pane typically opens on the right side, showing a thread of all comments on the slide.

questions.question: Why is it important to have a 'Financials' section in a business pitch?
options: To demonstrate the profitability and financial viability of the business to investors
questions.explanation: Investors need to know how the business will make money, the costs involved, and projected profits.

questions.question: The 'Ink' group in the Review tab (if available) allows you to:
options: Annotate slides with digital pens or hide ink
questions.explanation: The Ink tools allow for drawing, highlighting, and erasing digital ink annotations.

questions.question: In a pitch, what does the 'USP' stand for?
questions.explanation: USP (Unique Selling Proposition) defines what makes your business different from and better than the competition.

questions.question: Can you Delete all comments on a slide at once?
options: No, you must delete them one by one
Yes, using the 'Delete' dropdown > 'Delete All Comments on Slide'
Only if you delete the slide
questions.explanation: The Delete menu in the Comments group offers options to delete the current comment or all comments on the slide/presentation.

questions.question: Which tool allows you to look up information on the web without leaving PowerPoint?
questions.explanation: Smart Lookup provides definitions, Wiki articles, and top related searches directly within the app.

questions.question: When creating a pitch for a Cafe, why use high-quality images of coffee and food?
options: To create visual appeal and communicate the quality/vibe of the product
questions.explanation: Visuals are crucial in a pitch to evoke emotion and demonstrate the product quality.

questions.question: If the 'Spelling' tool finds a word it doesn't recognize, but it is correct (e.g., a brand name), what should you click?
questions.explanation: Clicking 'Ignore' tells PowerPoint to skip that specific instance, while 'Ignore All' skips every instance of that word.
